page.title: 17BRANT BROUGHTON DAIRY FARM
page.content: Our farm "The Dairies" is in the area of Brant Broughton known as the clays. This kind of land is good for grassland and crops.The farm has an acreage of 142 and consists of grassland of which there are 100 acres The rest is for barley growing which is winter barley. We are dairy farmers and have 100 cows. These are mainly friesians which can produce 2000 gallons of milk each per year. Some of the cows are in calf to charolais and limousin bulls. We were the second people to breed Belgian blue cattle in this country. They are becoming a popular breed. During the summer the cows feed on one half of the grassland and the other half is used for silage which provides winter feed for the cows together with the barley.We have only a little farm machinery.
